intro: Johnia willdenowia, commonly known as the willdenow's johnia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
